name: ModifyEnvFileSystemShortcut
description:
Update a file system shortcut in a specific environment.

This tool updates a file system shortcut for a specific project environment based on given identifiers. Call this tool when you need to modify details of an existing file system shortcut within an environment.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the project to access. Retrieve it via a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: shortcut_id
parameters.description: A UUID string that uniquely identifies the file system shortcut to update.

parameters.name: file_system_shortcut_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the file system shortcut to be updated.

parameters.name: shortcut_file_path
parameters.description: The path to the file system shortcut that needs to be updated in the environment.

parameters.name: file_system_shortcut_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the file system shortcut to update, such as 'symlink' or 'hardlink'.

parameters.name: reference_identifier
parameters.description: A unique string identifier for the file system shortcut to be updated.

parameters.name: shortcut_href
parameters.description: The URL or link to the file system shortcut that needs updating. This should be a valid URI.

parameters.name: created_at_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of when the file system shortcut was created, in ISO 8601 format.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this file system shortcut.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this file system shortcut.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
